name: Baby Keem
description:
'''Hykeem Jamaal Carter Jr.''' (born October 22, 2000), known professionally as '''Baby Keem''', is an American rapper and record producer. Raised in [[Las Vegas]], he gained recognition in the late 2010s with his contributions to ''[[Black Panther (soundtrack)|Black Panther: The Album]]'' by his cousin [[Kendrick Lamar]], as well as ''[[Redemption (Jay Rock album)|Redemption]]'' by [[Jay Rock]], ''[[Crash Talk]]'' by [[Schoolboy Q]], and ''[[The Lion King: The Gift]]'' by [[Beyonc√©]]. As a lead artist, he gained initial recognition for his 2019 [[sleeper hit]] single "[[Orange Soda (song)|Orange Soda]]", which received [[RIAA certification|quadruple platinum]] certification by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA).

Keem signed with [[PGLang]], in a joint venture with [[Columbia Records]], to release his debut studio album, ''[[The Melodic Blue]]'' (2021). A critical success, it peaked at number five on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] and was certified platinum by the RIAA; its single "[[Family Ties (song)|Family Ties]]" won [[Grammy Award for Best Rap Performance|Best Rap Performance]] at the [[64th Annual Grammy Awards]]. His collaborations with [[Kanye West]] on ''[[Donda]]'' (2021) and Lamar on ''[[Mr. Morale & the Big Steppers]]'' (2022) earned him two nominations for [[Grammy Award for Album of the Year|Album of the Year]] at the 64th and [[65th Annual Grammy Awards]], respectively.
